wiki.content:
"Ocean Avenue" was Yellowcard's breakthrough single. This song is the second single from Ocean Avenue and the third track. It is known for bringing them into the mainstream, as it received numerous spins on MTV and increasing radio airplay. Ocean Avenue is a street in Neptune Beach, which is one of the beach suburbs of Jacksonville, the band's stomping grounds, which they left behind when they moved to LA.
 
 While the song was not officially released until September 2004, it was played on several radio stations in the US throughout the summer before.
 
 On Tuesday, December 22nd, 2009, "Ocean Avenue" was released as a downloadable song for the music/rhythm game, Rock Band.
 
 Background
 
 According to former guitarist Ben Harper, "Ocean Avenue" is written about Jacksonville. "It’s this place where we used to hang out in Jacksonville. Instead of talking about a girl, it’s talking about a scene and a feeling that we want to get back to: hanging out and writing, before we moved to California."
 
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Ocean Avenue" was Yellowcard's breakthrough single. This song is the second single from Ocean Avenue and the third track. It is known for bringing them into the mainstream, as it received numerous spins on MTV and increasing radio airplay. Ocean Avenue is a street in Neptune Beach, which is one of the beach suburbs of Jacksonville, the band's stomping grounds, which they left behind when they moved to LA.

track.name: Ocean Avenue
comments: One of the only songs I can't help but sing along with.
Leave this town and run forever...
love this song reminds me of my youth!
Love this song!  I've heard it for years, yet did not know it was by them.
Yellowcard's brand new full band promo photo - Vote Up if you like it http://www.last.fm/music/Yellowcard/+images/78945265
You've listened to Yellowcard 6,423 times and this track 255 times. Still such an awesome song. :D
Hmm, what would we prefer, hearing this on the radio, or Nicki Minaj.
This song pretty much defined my childhood, still love listening to it!
If I could find you now things would get better, we could leave this town and run forever let your waves crash down on me, and take me away
boyfriend says he think of me when listening to this song can't say I blame him I think of him too :3
